title: LR circuit - energy stored in an inductor

content.question: A circuit is constructed from a battery of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="open E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>, a switch, an inductor of inductance <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>, and three identical resistors of resistance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, connected as shown in the diagram. The switch is initially open. Which of the following expressions best indicates the energy stored in the inductor a long time after the switch has been closed?

choices.label: <math alttext="one eighteenth, times the fraction with numerator L times open E squared, and denominator R squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>18</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><mi>L</mi><msup><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="one eighth, times the fraction with numerator L times open E squared, and denominator R squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>8</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><mi>L</mi><msup><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 9 over 16, end fraction, times the fraction with numerator L times open E squared, and denominator R squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>9</mn><mn>16</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><mi>L</mi><msup><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one eighteenth, times the fraction with numerator L times open E squared, and denominator R squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>18</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><mi>L</mi><msup><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

topic.text: 13.5: Circuits with Resistors and Inductors (LR Circuits)

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
